verses.roman:
gaṅgā-tīra-pathe lañā prayāge āilā
śrī-rūpa āsi' prabhuke tathāi mililā

synonyms: gaṅgā-tīra-pathe—the path on the bank of the Ganges; lañā—taking; prayāge—in Allahabad; āilā—arrived; śrī-rūpa—of the name Śrī Rūpa; āsi'-coming there; prabhuke—Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; tathāi—there; mililā—met.
translation: After leaving Mathurā, the Lord began to walk along a path on the bank of the Ganges, and finally He reached the holy place named Prayāga [Allahabad]. It was there that Śrīla Rūpa Gosvāmī came and met the Lord.
